name: Artifact
headline: A modern workspace for electrical design
description: Artifact is a 2D electrical system CAD tool leveraging AI to automate tedious, error-prone tasks: datasheet ingestion, multi-fidelity system design, and manufacturing documentation

founders.name: Corbin Klett, Founder
founders.description: Corbin Klett is an aerospace engineering PhD from Georgia Tech, where he applied cutting-edge control theory research to robotic systems. After spending a couple of years in industry working on design and embedded software for a high-speed aircraft prototype, he cofounded Artifact. The team’s current focus is on building software tools that accelerate hardware engineering workflows, specifically in the area of electrical and avionics systems design.

founders.name: Antony Samuel, Founder
founders.description: Antony Samuel is an electrical engineer with eight years of experience developing avionics and software for complex aerospace systems. Most recently, he was the Avionics Lead at Hermeus, where he built the team and infrastructure behind the avionics for the world’s fastest aircraft (Mach 5). Now, as co-founder of Artifact, Antony is building next-generation design tools to accelerate hardware engineering, with a focus on avionics and electrical system design.

raw_markdown="![Aceternity Logo](https://www.artifact.engineer/_next/image?url=%2F03-Artifact-Logo-Lockup-Horizontal-White.png&w=384&q=75)
About Us[](https://www.artifact.engineer/<https:/twitter.com/ArtifactEngr>)[](https://www.artifact.engineer/<https:/www.linkedin.com/company/artifactengr/about/>)[](https://www.artifact.engineer/<https:/discord.gg/wyxDhAZTZc>)
[![Y Combinator](https://www.artifact.engineer/_next/image?url=%2Fyc_white.png&w=384&q=75)](https://www.artifact.engineer/<https:/www.ycombinator.com/launches/MkA-artifact-a-modern-workspace-for-electrical-design>)
# 
A modern workspacefor electrical design.
Artifact is an electrical system design tool that lets you design at any level of fidelity - from concept to connector.
[Join Waitlist](https://www.artifact.engineer/</signup>)[Book a Demo](https://www.artifact.engineer/<https:/calendly.com/antony-artifact/20min>)
## Intelligently designed electrical systems
![AI Datasheet Parser](https://www.artifact.engineer/data_sheet_parser.gif)
### Context-Aware Design
Artifact builds a single-source-of-truth that allows electrical engineers to iteratively create and evolve complex systems.
![Pinout Table](https://www.artifact.engineer/pintable.gif)
### AI Engineering Copilot
Artifact's AI assists with tedious tasks like parsing datasheets, generating harness drawings, and performing engineering calculations.
![PCB Integration](https://www.artifact.engineer/insert_pcb.gif)
### Multi-Fidelity Workspace
No constraints on your creativity - design at the right level of fidelity and easily generate pinout tables, bills of materials, and detailed views based on engineering needs.
## Design Example using Artifact
## We built a Mach 5 jet engine together.Now we're building the tools we wish we had.
[![Antony](https://www.artifact.engineer/_next/image?url=%2FAntony.jpg&w=3840&q=75)](https://www.artifact.engineer/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/antony-samuel/>)
### [Antony Samuel (CEO)](https://www.artifact.engineer/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/antony-samuel/>)
Antony is an electrical engineer who has built engineering teams and designed complex avionics systems for high speed, flight-proven aircraft and jet engine prototypes.
[![Corbin](https://www.artifact.engineer/_next/image?url=%2FCorbin.jpg&w=3840&q=75)](https://www.artifact.engineer/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/corbinklett/>)
### [Corbin Klett (CTO)](https://www.artifact.engineer/<https:/www.linkedin.com/in/corbinklett/>)
Corbin is a PhD aerospace engineer from Georgia Tech who develops flight simulators and embedded flight control systems for aircraft and spacecraft.

generated_description:
Artifact is positioning itself as a game-changer in the realm of electrical design, launched in 2025 from Atlanta, GA. Initially developed as a 2D CAD tool, it leverages the power of AI to free designers from monotonous and error-prone tasks like datasheet ingestion, system design, and documentation. The mission here is clear: to create a modern workspace that elevates electrical design from concept all the way to detailed products.

The startup is part of Y Combinator's Batch W25, which is really a badge of honor and highlights its innovative potential. With a tiny but mighty team of just two employees, co-founders Antony Samuel and Corbin Klett, they embody the passionate spirit of startup culture. Antony, with his background in avionics for high-speed aircraft, and Corbin, an aerospace PhD from Georgia Tech, bring a wealth of knowledge to the table.

Artifact’s platform supports multi-fidelity design—meaning you can choose the level of detail you need at any point in your project. Whether you're drafting a schematic or generating pinout tables, Artifact allows for an adaptable workflow without constraining creativity. Their AI component, dubbed an "Engineering Copilot," assists with many mundane tasks, enabling engineers to focus on what truly matters: innovation and design excellence.

If you’re an electrical engineer looking to streamline your design process, Artifact might just be the tool you need. You can check out their website at [artifact.engineer](https://www.artifact.engineer/) to learn more, join their waitlist, or book a demo.

In summary, Artifact is almost like a conversation between tradition and technology, aiming to revolutionize how electrical systems are designed and built. In a landscape where complexity is the norm, Artifact is striving to simplify your workflow, allowing for creativity and precision to coexist in perfect harmony.
